title: Memorial HoopsFest makes a comeback
description: After a six-year hiatus, the 3v3 Memorial HoopsFest Tournament returns to Geick Park this Saturday celebrating sportsmanship, comradery and town pride. Help make HoopsFest a slam dunk while...
author: Janice Seiferling

content.text:
After a six-year hiatus, the 3v3 Memorial HoopsFest Tournament returns to
Geick Park this Saturday celebrating
sportsmanship, comradery and town
pride.
Help make HoopsFest a slam dunk
while cheering on local youths and adults
playing basketball for trophies and
fundraising. Forging new friendships, free
food and drinks, vendors, raffles and
prizes will grace the day. Spectators also
have the park's usual amenities throughout the day, including the volleyball courts
that will be open to the public.
"This year we honor the legacy of the
community," said Ian Daley, founder and
director of HoopsFest. "People can show
up as spectators, support the players and,
if they want, make donations," he said.
Tournament entry fees go toward the
Jude & Zachary Foundation's scholarship
fund, a 501(c)(3) honoring the legacy of a
father and son whose lives continue to
inspire the community, according to
Daley. The foundation awards scholarships to student athletes selected by their
coaches and community leaders based on Photo By of Ian Daley
Former HoopsFest players enjoy the spirited competition.
